intro: Echeveria metallica, commonly known as the metallic echeveria, is a succulent native to Mexico. It features rosettes of thick, fleshy leaves that are typically silver or blue-gray in color, giving it a metallic appearance. The leaves are covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss and reflects sunlight. It produces striking pink or purple flowers in spring, adding visual interest to its appearance. This plant is well-suited for rock gardens or as a container plant due to its compact growth habit and low maintenance requirements.
